description: Redevelopment of the site to provide a three-storey mixed-use industrial building (Use Classes B1/B2/B8) with associated car and cycle parking; and refuse facilities (following demolition of existing light industrial building, rear shed structure and removal forecourt parking).
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 14MR_000 Rev B (site plan and block plan); 14MR_101 Rev A (proposed plan); 14MR_102 Rev A (proposed plans); 14MR_103 Rev A (proposed plans); 14MR_004 Rev B (proposed elevations); 14MR_005 Rev B (proposed elevations); 14MR_006 Rev A (proposed sections); 14MR_201 (demolition of ground floor); 14MR_202 (demolition of first floor); 14MR_203 (existing elevations); 14MR_204 (demolition elevations); Transport Statement; Drainage Assessment form and Sustainable Underground Drainage Systems Report
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Publication London Plan(2020) policies D1, D3 and D4; policy D4 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Artificial external lighting to the frontage and side vehicle access road and rear parking within the curtilage of the site, including the cycle storage area, shall be installed prior to occupation of the building

Proposed lighting shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution 2011'. Lighting should be minimised and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.
Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future

occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); policies 7.1 of the London Plan (2016); policies D4, and D11 of the Publication London Plan(2020); policy D6 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018)and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from internal uses, activities and plant is contained within the building, according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. offices and external amenity spaces. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy D14 of the Publication London Plan(2020); policy D6 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018) and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD(2013)

| Prior to commencement of development (with the exception of demolition and site clearance) an Energy Strategy in accordance with the latest Mayoral Energy Assessment Guidance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure the development complies with the Mayoral net-zero carbon target in accordance with policy SI2 of the Publication London Plan(2020) and its related supplementary guidance for energy strategies; and policy EU9 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018).

| Prior to first occupation of the development, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) shall be submitted to demonstrate that the approved sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed and will be managed and maintained in accordance with the Sustainable Underground Drainage Systems Report approved in condition 2. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development does not indirectly create any new flood risk or ground instability elsewhere by ensuring that a sufficient storage of surface water runoff is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); policy SI13 of the Publication London Plan(2020); and policy EU3 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018)   and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The lift serving units 2 and 3 shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the upper floors.

Reason: To ensure that adequate access is provided to the upper floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies 7.2 of the London Plan (2016); policy D5 of the Publication London Plan(2020); policy D3 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018); and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and interim Ealing SPG 'Accessible Ealing' (2012).

| A delivery and servicing plan (DSP) for the development detailing servicing arrangements, times and frequency and operational details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The servicing of the development shall be operated strictly in accordance with the approved details, and shall be maintained as such thereafter. Any changes to the approved plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing first by the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding residential and commercial premises are not adversely affected by noise, and that resulting servicing arrangements are satisfactory in terms of their impact on highway safety, the free-flow of traffic in accordance with policies: 6.7 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and Publication London Plan(2020) policies D3, D14 and T7 and policy T7 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018). | A Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior first use of the approved scheme. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of the employees and visitors in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. This should include a drop off strategy for those travelling to the site by car. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To promote the use of modes of sustainable transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in accordance with Policy 6.1 of the London Plan (2016); Publication London Plan(2020) policies T1; policy T7of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018) and Policy 1.1 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012). | Prior to the commencement of development, including demolition and site clearance, a Demolition and Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. The plan shall include the following:
(i)	Demolition:

o	Hours and details of demolition method including details of enclosure; mitigation measures for dust control (in accordance with the Mayoral SPG for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition); site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications; location, numbers and frequency of vehicles
o	Compliance with waste reduction to support the circular economy
(ii)	Construction
o	Details of construction hours; Demolition and Construction methods including piling method statement;

o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials; Site security during construction; Site management and access; Vehicle and machinery specifications; Location, numbers and frequency of vehicles/deliveries and measures to ensure construction does not have an effect on neighbouring highways as part of a Construction Logistics Plan (CLP);

o	Control measures for noise and vibration (information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014)
o	Mitigation measures for dust control (in accordance with the Mayoral SPG for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition)
o	Lighting (Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011 by the Institution of Lighting Professionals)
o	Construction worker parking
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents

The Demolition and Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies D12 , T7, SI1 and SI8 of the Publication London Plan(2020); and policies SP10, T7 and T8 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018). | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/usernrmm/ register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: In in the interests of air quality and amenity in accordance with policy 5.1 of the London Plan (2016) and policy SI1 of the Publication London Plan(2020) and policy T8 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018).
| The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of

any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development. In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement / photographic evidence to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied. The evidence shall include waste disposal transfer notes proving correct disposal of soil.
Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately
addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is

suitable for the proposed use in accordance with policy SI1 of the Publication London Plan(2020) and policy EU13 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018). | The cycle parking hereby approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development in accordance with the approved plans in Condition 2. Cycle provision shall comprise a minimum of 12 long stay and 2 short stay cycle parking spaces. Any variation to the approved plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the modification being undertaken. The approved details shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the good growth objectives of the Publication London Plan (2020), and for encouraging sustainable modes of transport in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), Publication London Plan (2020) policy T5 and table 10.2; policy T3 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018); policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | The refuse and recycling area shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development and retained thereafter and these areas shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); Publication London Plan (2020) policy D3; policy D4 and T7 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities.

| Prior to commencement of development (excluding demolition and site clearance) details of plant and machinery shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the rating sound level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To safeguard future and existing occupiers of the area against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), Publication London Plan (2020) policy D14; policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Prior to occupation of the development a security management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and to the satisfaction of the designing out crime officer.

Reason: In the interest of the safety of the future occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.3,7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policy D11 of the Publication London Plan(2020); policy D4 of the Old Oak Park Royal Development Corporation Draft Local Plan (revised 2018); policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
